events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim for damages sustained on the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the details of the collision and vehicle damage.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to manage the investigation and communication regarding the auto accident claim.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the claimant that the case is being processed promptly.
The agent requested additional documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed photos and an official police report, facilitating the claim investigation.
The insurance investigation team began assessing the provided evidence and contacted local authorities to verify collision details.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and confirmed the extent of damage corresponds to the provided reports and photos.
A fair settlement offer was proposed to cover the cost of vehicle repairs, rental car reimbursement, and associated expenses.
The claimant acknowledged the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the timely and transparent communication throughout the process.
The claim was officially approved for payment following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the insured party.
An immediate payment was issued to the claimant for the agreed settlement amount to cover the auto repairs and additional costs.
The claim was closed successfully after all payments were processed and no further actions or disputes were reported by the claimant.
The complete claim file was archived in the insurerâ€™s records system for future reference and compliance with regulatory requirements.
